main_definition: Domains refer to the areas of expertise, authority, or control that an individual or entity has over a particular subject matter.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Area of scientific study or knowledge
meanings_and_examples.example: The domains of biology include genetics, ecology, and physiology.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Authority or control over a particular subject matter
meanings_and_examples.example: As the CEO of the company, he has full authority in his domain of business operations.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The various sectors or segments that make up a larger field or industry
meanings_and_examples.example: In the technology industry, some important domains include software development, hardware manufacturing, and cybersecurity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A collection of web addresses managed by a domain name registrar
meanings_and_examples.example: My company manages several domains for our clients' websites, such as www.example.com and www.sample-site.org.
